thread.title: Militant hideout busted in Poonch; huge cache of arms recovered
thread.title_full: Militant hideout busted in Poonch; huge cache of arms recovered

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Militant hideout busted in Poonch; huge cache of arms recovered
text:
Jammu, October 16
The Army and police today jointly busted a militant hideout and recovered a large cache of arms and ammunition, including 8 weapons, six IEDs and 20 kg of explosive, from the mountainous region of Poonch district.
Acting on specific information, a joint team of the Rastriya Rifles and police launched a swift and surgical search operation in Chapriyan forest belt of Poonch district, defence spokesman said.
They busted a hideout and recovered a huge cache of arms, ammunition and other “war-like” stores, which include one AK-47 rifle, one 12 bore rifle, one Chinese, two Pak origin & one country-made pistol, two Under Barrel Grenade launchers (UBGLs), two RPG boosters and five IEDs along with timers, he said.
Two Chinese grenades along with 47 rounds of AK, 370 Pika rounds, six pistol rounds, two RPG rounds, two UBGL rounds, 10 AK–47 magzines, five pistol magazines, approximately 20 Kg explosives, 500 grams plastic explosive, cordtex safety fuse, firing cable, mobile phone, Battery, Binocular, Insulation tape and wireless system were also recovered from the spot, he said.
The recovered cache of arms and stores are suspected to belong to some terrorist outfit which could have hidden it for later usage, he said.
Seizure of such “war-like” stores will prove detrimental to the revival of terrorism in the area and further strengthen the existing security grid, the spokesman said, adding it indeed thwarted evil designs of the militants. — PTI
